resource_data:
<expression xsi:schemaLocation="http://www.imsglobal.org/xsd/imslorsltitm_v1p0 http://fire.eun.org/lode/imslorsltitm_v1p0.xsd" xmlns="http://www.imsglobal.org/xsd/imslorsltitm_v1p0" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance">
  <identifier>
    <catalog>hdl</catalog>
    <entry>10494/106574</entry>
  </identifier>
  <identifier>
    <catalog>expression-cmr-id</catalog>
    <entry>106574</entry>
  </identifier>
  <description>
    <facet>
      <vocabularyID>LRE.expressionDescriptionFacetValues</vocabularyID>
      <value>main</value>
    </facet>
    <metadata>
      <schema>http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM</schema>
      <lom xsi:schemaLocation="http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/lomv1.0/lomLoose.xsd" xmlns="http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM">
        <general>
          <identifier>
            <catalog>oercommons.org</catalog>
            <entry>1770206287</entry>
          </identifier>
          <title>
            <string language="en">Earth from Space</string>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Masse vom Platz</string>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">La terre de l'espace</string>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">Terra do espaço</string>
            <string language="x-mt-it">Terra da spazio</string>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Γη από το διάστημα</string>
            <string language="x-mt-es">Tierra del espacio</string>
          </title>
          <description>
            <string language="en">presents selected photos of features and processes of the earth, including cities, as seen by astronauts from space. Photos are from the NASA Space Shuttle Earth Observations Photography database, which contains more than 375,000 images.</string>
          </description>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">Science and Technology</string>
          </keyword>
          <language>en</language>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Geschenke wählten Fotos der Merkmale und der 
Prozesse der Masse, einschließlich Städte aus, wie von den 
Astronauten gesehen vom Platz. Fotos sind von der die NASA 
Platz-Doppelventilkegel-Masse Beobachtungen Fotographie Datenbank, die
mehr als 375.000 Bilder enthält.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">les présents ont choisi des photos des 
dispositifs et des processus de la terre, y compris des villes, comme 
vu par des astronautes à partir de l'espace. Les photos sont de
la base de données de photographie d'observations de la terre de 
navette spatiale de la NASA, qui contient plus de 375.000 images.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">os presentes selecionaram fotos das 
características e dos processos da terra, including cidades, como 
visto por astronautas do espaço. As fotos são da base de dados
da fotografia das observações da terra do shuttle de espaço da 
NASA, que contem mais de 375.000 imagens.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-it">i presenti hanno selezionato le foto delle 
caratteristiche e dei processi della terra, compreso le città, come 
visto dagli atronauti a partire da spazio. Le foto provengono 
dalla base di dati di fotographia di osservazioni della terra della 
spola di spazio della NASA, che contiene più di 375.000 immagini.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-el">παρουσιάζει τις επιλεγμένες φωτογραφίες των 
χαρακτηριστικών γνωρισμάτων και των διαδικασιών της γης, 
συμπεριλαμβανομένων των πόλεων, όπως βλέπει από τους 
αστροναύτες από το διάστημα. Οι φωτογραφίες είναι από τη 
διαστημική βάση δεδομένων φωτογραφίας γήινων παρατηρήσεων 
σαϊτών της NASA, η οποία περιέχει περισσότεροι από 375.000
εικόνες.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-es">los presentes seleccionaron las fotos de 
características y de procesos de la tierra, incluyendo ciudades, 
según lo considerado por los astronautas de espacio. Las fotos 
son de la base de datos de la fotografía de las observaciones de la 
tierra de la lanzadera de espacio de la NASA, que contiene más de 
375.000 imágenes.</string>
          </description>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Wissenschaft und Technologie</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">La Science et technologie</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">Ciência e tecnologia</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-it">Scienza e tecnologia</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Επιστήμη και τεχνολογία</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-es">Ciencia y tecnología</string>
          </keyword>
        </general>
        <metaMetadata>
          <identifier>
            <catalog>oercommons.org</catalog>
            <entry>1770206287</entry>
          </identifier>
          <language>en</language>
        </metaMetadata>
        <educational>
          <language>en</language>
        </educational>
        <rights>
          <copyrightAndOtherRestrictions>
            <source>copyrightAndOtherRestrictionsValues</source>
            <value>yes</value>
          </copyrightAndOtherRestrictions>
          <description>
            <string language="en">Custom License</string>
          </description>
        </rights>
      </lom>
    </metadata>
  </description>
  <manifestation>
    <identifier>
      <catalog>manifestation-cmr-id</catalog>
      <entry>106574</entry>
    </identifier>
    <name>
      <vocabularyID>LRE.manifestationNameValues</vocabularyID>
      <value>experience</value>
    </name>
    <item>
      <location>
        <uri>http://www.oercommons.org/courses/earth-from-space</uri>
      </location>
    </item>
  </manifestation>
</expression>
